attributes.action: Freeze rent and accommodation fees for students
attributes.additional_details: Students return to university and to rent accommodation after government assurances that it was safe to do so.  The current lockdown has left many students jobless and in a dire economic situation. Consequently, many students are now trapped in these leases with no means to pay the rent for the foreseeable future.  The government has a responsibility to protect the financial and emotional well-being of the students that are suffering as a result of their catastrophic policies.
attributes.background: The government must advise universities to freeze accommodation fee for their students. Students who are renting privately must also be allowed this.

rejection.details:
Suspending payments for rent or ending a tenancy early is a matter for individual landlords, and not the UK Government or Parliament.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Enable all students to end university tenancy agreements early due to Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553285

Implement support for university students during Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554299
